definition: to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street

sentences.english: It's women's nature to go shoping.
sentences.chinese: 逛街購物是女人的天性。
小朋友們在逛街買東西。

sentences.english: But I like street shopping. There is more variety.
sentences.chinese: 但我還是喜歡逛街購物，有比較多的東西可看。

sentences.english: Downtown shopping, I saw a picture of the machine.
sentences.chinese: 到市中心逛街時，看見一部拍大頭貼的機器。

sentences.english: I went shopping with my mum and aunty today.
sentences.chinese: 下午我跟我的阿姨和老媽逛街去了。

sentences.english: Like other women, Lori loved shopping and eating gourmand food.
sentences.chinese: 與其他女人一樣，逛街和美食同樣是她的愛好。

sentences.english: My new purchase yesterday, tie dye T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 昨天逛街的收穫，扎染T恤。

sentences.english: But I have to get to the shop. Mr. Dwyer is expecting me.
sentences.chinese: 可是我要去逛街，德維爾先生還等着我呢。

sentences.english: I always window-shop with my friends.
sentences.chinese: 我經常和我朋友一起逛街。
首先女人爲什麼喜歡逛街？

sentences.english: ALet’s go shopping on Saturday morning.
sentences.chinese: A咱們週六上午去逛街吧。

sentences.english: Yesteray when I went shopping, I discovered bracelets are sold in Shanghai Giordano.
sentences.chinese: 昨天當我去逛街時，發現上海佐丹努正在銷售手環。

sentences.english: After getting the salary, she went shopping immediately.
sentences.chinese: 她剛領了工資就跑去逛街了。

sentences.english: If I were you, I wouldn't wear high-heels to go shopping.
sentences.chinese: 如果我是你，我絕對不會穿高跟鞋去逛街。

sentences.english: Orange enable car information makes it possible make sure and before you set about window shopping.
sentences.chinese: 橙使汽車信息使得有可能確定之前，你對逛街集。

sentences.english: I saw a beautiful clock last time I was shopping and I wanted to get it for her.
sentences.chinese: 我上次逛街時看見一個石英鐘挺漂亮的，想送給她。

definition: variant of 軋馬路|轧马路[ya4 ma3 lu4]
to stroll around the streets (esp. of a young couple)
to go onto the streets/to go shopping
to roam around/to have a stroll
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
to take a walk/to go for a walk
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
to spend time in a bar (alcohol, Internet etc)/to go clubbing
(dialect) to take a walk/to go for a stroll
